Learning Objects in Vista A review and an overview
Carlos Araya
cal
0.1 2006-06-20 First draft for review.
Introduction
Learning Object in Vista: A review and an overview is an intermediate to advanced workshop for users of Vista 4 who are interested in learning objects: What they are, how they work and how they are implemented in Vista. This is not a beginning-level workshop. It is inteded for faculty and staff thow are already familiar with Vista and who are using Vista to deliver courses. Assumptions are made as to the participants' knowledge of the tool and how to use it to build content, how to usse the HTML editor among others.
Audience
This workshop is intended as a complement to Vista 101 and Transition to Vista and is also open to those community members who are interested in Learning Objects, Content Sharing and how they are implemented in Vista.
Objectives
After the completion of this workshop participants will be able to:
Describe the main characteristics of a learning object
Explain how to build a learning object
Incorporate existing Learning Objects directly to Vista course
Identify 5 areas where Content Sharing can be used
Define 3 strategies for collaborating using Content Sharing and Learning Objects
What are learning objects
There are as many definitions of Learning Objects as there are people working with them. Some definitions are:
We treat reusable learning objects are web-based interactive chunks of e-learning designed to explain a stand-alone learning objective. The fact that the learning object has been broken down to a low level of granularity facilitates its reuse in different learning and teaching situations (CELT 2006)
